intro: Althaea danubialis, commonly known as the Danube marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its roots produce a mucilaginous substance, which has been used traditionally for its soothing properties. Althaea danubialis typically grows in wet or marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
